text: al-Musallā, Arabic: (al-musallā) is the name for an open space outside a mosque that is mainly used for praying.The Encyclopaedia of Islam. New Edition. Brill, Leiden. Vol. 7, pg. 658; al-mausūʿa al-fiqhiyya. Kuwait 1998. Vol. 38, pg 29 The words is derived from the verb (sallā) which means to pray. ==References== Category:Mosques
title: Musalla
